intro: Tapiphyllum molle, commonly known as the soft-leaved tapiphyllum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its soft, velvety leaves and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
